intro: Macbridea caroliniana, commonly known as Carolina macbridea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and opposite, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
